Name: Northwest Community Bail Fund
Short description: The Northwest Community Bail Fund (NCBF) provides cash bail for marginalized people charged with crimes who are unable to afford bail.

Name: Nashville Community Bail Fund
Short description: The Nashville Community Bail Fund frees low-income persons from jail, connects with their loved ones, and works to end wealth-based detention through community partnerships.

Name: Memphic Community Bail Fund
Short description: Our mission is to advance policies and programs within Shelby County and the State of Tennessee that strengthen the right to counsel.

Name: Soda City Bail Out
Short description: Our mission is to keep marginalized people out of detention and to raise abolitionist political consciousness by organizing people to build community without jails and prisons.

Name: Philadelphia Bail Fund
Short description: A revolving fund that posts bail for people who are indigent and cannot afford bail.

Name: Portland Freedom Fund
Short description: A volunteer-run abolitionist organization currently dedicated to reducing harms by the criminal justice system through posting bail.

Name: North Carolina Community Bail Fund
Short description: The North Carolina Community Bail Fund of Durham fights to end cash bail and provides assistance to those who cannot afford it.

Name: Emergency RElease Fund - NY
Short description: The mission of the Emergency Release Fund is to ensure that no trans person at risk in New York City jails remains in detention before trial.

Name: Kansas City Community Bail Fund
Short description: Our mission is to provide bail for people without the resources to post their own.

Name: Minnesota Freedon Fund
Short description: Since 2016, our mission has been to pay criminal bail and immigration bonds for those who cannot afford to.

Name: Massachussetts Bail Fund
Short description: Posts bails of up to $5000 in Essex, Suffolk, & Worcester Counties in Massachusetts.

Name: NorCal Resist Bail Fund
Short description: Helps community members facing protest and ICE-related charges make bail.

Name: Tuscon Second Chance Community Bail Fund
Short description: Addresses the disproportionate impact of the cash bail system on communities of color and vulnerable populations.

Name: Tuscaloosa Bail Out
Short description: The Tuscaloosa Bail Out draws on the liberatory and abolitionist framework developed by the National Bail Fund Network.

Name: Montgomery Bail Out Fund
Short description: We are raising money to provide support and post bail for people in the Montgomery County Jail

Name: Stritmatter, Kessler, Koehler, & Moore
Short description: Providing legal services to any peaceful protestor, bystander, member of the media, or any other person who was injured due to unwarranted excessive force by the police in the recent and ongoing BLM/George Floyd protests.

Name: Legal Aid Justice Center
Short description: The Legal Aid Justice Center provides free legal services on non-criminal matters to income eligible persons.

Name: Volunteer Lawyers for Justice
Short description: VLJ is a non-profit law office that provides FREE legal services to low-income people in New Jersey.

Name: Ashley Holub's Pro Bono Attorney List
Short description: Google Sheet of pro bono attorneys by state

Name: Derouen Law Firm - Pro Bono Attorney Directory
Short description: Directory of Pro-Bono Attorneys For Protestors

Name: American Bar Association Pro Bono Resources
Short description: Ensuring access to justice through the expansion and enhancement of the delivery of legal and other law-related services to the underserved

Name: Baltimore Action Legal Team
Short description: Provides legal support to Baltimore communities as they exercise their civil liberties.
Category: Regional Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals

Name: Southern Center for Human Rights
Short description: The Southern Center for Human Rights is working for equality, dignity, and justice for people impacted by the criminal legal system in the Deep South.
Category: Regional Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals

Name: Southern Poverty Law Center
Short description: The SPLC is a catalyst for racial justice in the South and beyond.
Category: Regional Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals

Name: Abolitionist Law Center
Short description: The Abolitionist Law Center is a public interest law firm organized for the purpose of abolishing class and race based mass incarceration.
Category: Regional Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals

Name: Civil Liberties Defense Center
Short description: Civil Liberties Defense Center supports movements that seek to dismantle the political and economic structures at the root of social inequality and environmental destruction.
Category: Regional Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals

Name: Community Activism Law Alliance (Beyond Legal Aid)
Short description: Beyond Legal Aid (formerly CALA) creates community activism-law programs for, by, with, and within our partner communities.
Category: Regional Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals

Name: NAACP Legal Defense and Educational Fund, Inc.
Short description: Americaâ€™s premier legal organization fighting for racial justice.
Category: National Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals

Name: Black Movement-Law Project
Short description: Black Movement-Law Project helps build the legal infrastructure necessary to protect emerging local movements.
Category: National Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals

Name: National Lawyers Guild Mass Defense Program
Short description: MDC is a network of lawyers, legal workers and law students providing legal support for political activists, protesters and movements for social change.
Category: National Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals

Name: Law for Black Lives
Short description: Law for Black Lives is a national community of radical lawyers and legal workers
Category: National Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals

Name: American Civil Liberties Union
Short description: ACLU fights for everyone's rights.
Category: National Legal Aid Resources for Organizations and Individuals
